channel.title: API Reference Guide
channel.description:
WIP as of 8/3/2015, methods listed are final.
[size=14pt][b]Java Modules[/b][/size]
[size=13pt]- World[/size]
[size=14pt][b]Lua Modules[/b][/size]
[size=14pt][b]World[/b][/size]
[size=13pt][font=trebuchet ms]CreateObject(plane, x, y, type, config, orientation)[/font][/size] [size=13pt][font=trebuchet ms]UpdateObject(plane, x, y, type, config, orientation)[/font][/size]
Creates a new game object at the specified coordinate. Note that if an object already exists at the specified coordinates for the object group with the provided type then the object is updated. [font=trebuchet ms][i]UpdateObject[/i][/font] is an alias for [font=trebuchet ms][i]CreateObject[/i][/font]. Both methods are provided to give clarity to users and a distinction for intended purpose.
[u]Example:[/u]
[code=lua] -- Spawns a tree at coordinates [0, 3222, 3222], using the type identity of a prop, facing north world:CreateObject(0, 3222 3222, obj.prop, obj.tree, obj.north)
-- Equivalent code world:UpdateObject(0, 3222 3222, obj.prop, obj.tree, obj.north) [/code]
[size=14pt][b]Java Models[/b][/size]
[size=14pt][b]Mobile[/b][/size]
[size=13pt][font=trebuchet ms]InteractWith(object, distance, closure)[/font][/size] [size=13pt][font=trebuchet ms]InteractWith(object, closure)[/font][/size]
Interacts with an entity. The provided closure will be triggered when the following conditions are met:
1). There is a line of sight between the mobile and the target. 2). The distance between the mobile and the target is less or equal to the specified distance.
If the mobile is interacting with another mobile entity the mobile will attempt to walk to the mobile to trigger the required conditions. This is done via appending a way point to the entities nearest adjacent position. If the mobile is interacting with an immobile entity, the mobile will make no attempt to walk to the immobile entity and the expected behavior is for a route to the immobile entity to either be predetermined, calculated, or provided from the client. If there are no pending way points or steps when the target is a game object, and the mobile entities interaction condition is not met the interaction is considered a failure and the mobile entity will stop attempting to interact with the immobile entity.
[u]Examples:[/u]
[code=lua] local player = SomeMoreCodeHere() local object = SomeCodeHere() player:InteractWith(object, function(player) player:Print('I am adjacent to the object!') end) [/code]

item.title: API Reference Guide
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

sini:

The amount of time wasted writing comments for everything is massive especially in large projects such as this. Which is why I stated, in my posts, that its slated for AFTER when I finish the core features.

Missed that, my apologizes.

Read full topic

Cause I rushed much of it?

Didn’t mean to sound dick-ish, but it is just really annoying to see stuff like this:

/** * * @param alloc * @param outgoingPackets * @param message */

item.description:
@supaz wrote:

You’ll need a TON more information that’s VERY specific to enable the novice level programmers to even start to comprehend the systems you use. Other than that, Like I said in IRC Lemme know when I can start writing content scripts!! You’re taking forever

item.title: API Reference Guide
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

WIP as of 8/3/2015, methods listed are final.

[size=14pt]Java Modules[/size]

[size=13pt]- World[/size]

[size=14pt]Lua Modules[/size]

[size=14pt]World[/size]

[size=13pt][font=trebuchet ms]CreateObject(plane, x, y, type, config, orientation)[/font][/size]
[size=13pt][font=trebuchet ms]UpdateObject(plane, x, y, type, config, orientation)[/font][/size]

Creates a new game object at the specified coordinate. Note that if an object already exists at the specified coordinates for the object group with the provided type then the object is updated. [font=trebuchet ms]UpdateObject[/font] is an alias for [font=trebuchet ms]CreateObject[/font]. Both methods are provided to give clarity to users and a distinction for intended purpose.

Example:

-- Spawns a tree at coordinates [0, 3222, 3222], using the type identity of a prop, facing north
world:CreateObject(0, 3222 3222, obj.prop, obj.tree, obj.north)

-- Equivalent code
world:UpdateObject(0, 3222 3222, obj.prop, obj.tree, obj.north)

[size=14pt]Java Models[/size]

[size=14pt]Mobile[/size]

[size=13pt][font=trebuchet ms]InteractWith(object, distance, closure)[/font][/size]
[size=13pt][font=trebuchet ms]InteractWith(object, closure)[/font][/size]

Interacts with an entity. The provided closure will be triggered when the following conditions are met:

1). There is a line of sight between the mobile and the target.
2). The distance between the mobile and the target is less or equal to the specified distance.

If the mobile is interacting with another mobile entity the mobile will attempt to walk to the mobile to trigger the required conditions. This is done via appending a way point to the entities nearest adjacent position. If the mobile is interacting with an immobile entity, the mobile will make no attempt to walk to the immobile entity and the expected behavior is for a route to the immobile entity to either be predetermined, calculated, or provided from the client. If there are no pending way points or steps when the target is a game object, and the mobile entities interaction condition is not met the interaction is considered a failure and the mobile entity will stop attempting to interact with the immobile entity.

Examples:

local player = SomeMoreCodeHere()
local object = SomeCodeHere()
player:InteractWith(object, function(player) player:Print('I am adjacent to the object!') end)

Read full topic
